dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Moody's just downgraded Kaspi Bank to a Caa2 rating, that's deep into speculative territory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moody's just downgraded Kaspi Bank to a Caa2 rating, that's deep into speculative territory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank, a core part of Kaspi.kzs Fintech Platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they cited declining profitability and dwindling liquidity as major factors. It's a pretty harsh assessment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they cited declining profitability and dwindling liquidity as major factors. It's a pretty harsh assessment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys cited sound profitability, liquidity and the resilience of Kaspi.kzs proven business model including Fintech, Payments and Marketplace Platforms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the negative outlook suggests things might get even worse. They're the whole business model is under pressure—Payments, Marketplace, Fintech, all struggling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the negative outlook suggests things might get even worse. They're the whole business model is under pressure-Payments, Marketplace, Fintech, all struggling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank, a core part of Kaspi.kzs Fintech Platform. According to Moodys: Kaspi.kzs proven business model has demonstrated resilience throughout the economic cycle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just internal issues; the operating environment in Belarus is deteriorating too. Moodys actually downgraded Kazakhstan's government rating recently as well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just internal issues; the operating environment in Belarus is deteriorating too. Moodys actually downgraded Kazakhstan's government rating recently as well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan will further benefit the companys fundamentals. The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan led Moodys on 9 September 2024 to upgrade its Kazakhstan government rating to Baa1 from Baa2, with a stable outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, but Kaspi.kz is based in Kazakhstan, right? The text mentions Belarus a few times—maybe that's a mix-up or a red herring?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, but the website is based in Kazakhstan, right? The text mentions Belarus a few times-maybe that's a mix-up or a red herring?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, good catch. That seems like an error, unless there's some regional exposure we're missing. Either way, the former CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, called the downgrade unexpected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, good catch. That seems like an error, unless there's some regional exposure we're missing. Either way, the former C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze, called the downgrade unexpected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO & co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Moodys has tracked our company for many years and watched our unique and highly successful Super App strategy unfold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Unexpected? But he also admitted their Super App strategy is flawed and they're losing customers, especially SMEs. That doesn't sound like a surprise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unexpected? But he also admitted their Super App strategy is flawed and they're losing customers, especially SMEs. That doesn't sound like a surprise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO & co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Moodys has tracked our company for many years and watched our unique and highly successful Super App strategy unfold. Were trusted by over 14 million Kazakhstanis and 700 thousand merchants, most of whom are small and medium-sized businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and then there's that sarcastic thank you to detractors—almost like they're leaning into the criticism. It's uh, kind of an unusual response from a company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and then there's that sarcastic thank you to detractors-almost like they're leaning into the criticism. It's uh, kind of an unusual response from a company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they delisted from Nasdaq earlier this year, which already signaled trouble. Plus, Harvard Business School pulled their case studies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they delisted from Nasdaq earlier this year, which already signaled trouble. Plus, Harvard Business School pulled their case studies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Harvard Business School has written two case studies on Kaspi.kz which it continues to teach to its MBA students. Kaspi.kz has been listed on Nasdaq since January 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So all in all, it's a perfect storm—bad ratings, failing products, unhappy customers, and now a credibility hit in academic circles too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So all in all, it's a perfect storm-bad ratings, failing products, unhappy customers, and now a credibility hit in academic circles too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how much longer they can sustain this downward spiral. Those forward-looking statements at the end don't inspire much confidence either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how much longer they can sustain this downward spiral. Those forward-looking statements at the end don't inspire much confidence either.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No, they really don't. It's like they're prepping everyone for more bad news down the line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, they really don't. It's like they're prepping everyone for more bad news down the line.

artist_script:
HostA: Moody's just downgraded Kaspi Bank to a Caa2 rating, that's deep into speculative territory.
HostB: Yeah, and they cited declining profitability and dwindling liquidity as major factors. It’s a pretty harsh assessment.
HostA: Right, and the negative outlook suggests things might get even worse. They’re the whole business model is under pressure—Payments, Marketplace, Fintech, all struggling.
HostB: And it’s not just internal issues; the operating environment in Belarus is deteriorating too. Moodys actually downgraded Kazakhstan’s government rating recently as well.
HostA: Wait, but Kaspi.kz is based in Kazakhstan, right? The text mentions Belarus a few times—maybe that’s a mix-up or a red herring?
HostB: Oh yeah, good catch. That seems like an error, unless there’s some regional exposure we’re missing. Either way, the former CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, called the downgrade unexpected.
HostA: Unexpected? But he also admitted their Super App strategy is flawed and they’re losing customers, especially SMEs. That doesn’t sound like a surprise.
HostB: Exactly, and then there’s that sarcastic thank you to detractors—almost like they’re leaning into the criticism. It’s uh, kind of an unusual response from a company.
HostA: And they delisted from Nasdaq earlier this year, which already signaled trouble. Plus, Harvard Business School pulled their case studies.
HostB: So all in all, it’s a perfect storm—bad ratings, failing products, unhappy customers, and now a credibility hit in academic circles too.
HostA: Makes you wonder how much longer they can sustain this downward spiral. Those forward-looking statements at the end don’t inspire much confidence either.
HostB: No, they really don’t. It’s like they’re prepping everyone for more bad news down the line.
